required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Evaluation of External Thermomechanical Stimulation for Pain Reduction in Patients Undergoing Nail Injection
clinical_study.official_title: The Evaluation of External Thermomechanical Stimulation for Pain Reduction in Patients Undergoing Nail Injection

lead_sponsor.agency: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

clinical_study.source: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy and safety of a thermomechanical device delivering vibration and cold stimuli in lowering pain during intramatricial nail injections

primary_outcome.measure: The level of pain and change in pain between each time point will be assessed using the Wong-Baker FACES scale with use of thermomechanical device delivering stimuli, without delivering stimuli, and without use of the thermomechanical device.
primary_outcome.time_frame: prior to treatment, immediately after the needle insertion and 5 minutes after injection
primary_outcome.description: Pain will be self-reported, using the Wong-Baker FACES (0-10, with 0 representing abscence of pain and 10 unbearable pain). Participants will be questioned about their level of pain in each nail prior to treatment, immediately after the needle insertion and 5 minutes after injection

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with at least one adverse event
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patients will be followed for 3 days following their nail injection
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events will only include those that are determined to be related to the study device

arm_group.description: The thermomechanical device is placed on the digit two centimeters proximally to the injection site with the ice wings frozen and the vibration mechanism switched on.

arm_group.arm_group_label: External thermomechanical device without delivering stimuli
arm_group.description: The thermomechanical device is placed on the digit two centimeters proximally to the injection site with the ice wings at room temperature (unfrozen) and the vibration mechanism switched off.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Nail injection without the external thermomechanical device
arm_group.description: Nail injections will be performed without the use of external thermomechanical stimuli.

intervention.intervention_name: External thermomechanical device delivering cold and vibration stimuli
intervention.description: the thermomechanical device will be placed on the digit 2 cm proximally to the injection site with the ice wings frozen and the vibration mechanism switched on, delivering vibration and cold stimuli to the area for 30 seconds before the intramatricial injection and until needle withdrawal

intervention.intervention_name: External thermomechanical device without delivering cold and vibration stimuli
intervention.description: the thermomechanical device will be placed on the digit 2 cm proximally to the injection site with the ice wings at unfrozen and the vibration mechanism switched off, for 30 seconds before the intramatricial injection and until needle withdrawal
intervention.arm_group_label: External thermomechanical device without delivering stimuli

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women aged 18 years or older
- Must understand and voluntarily sign an informed consent form
- All patients undergoing intramatricial nail injections at the Weill Cornell Medicine (WCM) Department of Dermatology
- Willingness to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability of the patient to provide written informed consent for any reason
- Failure to have nail injection performed
- Likely inability to comply with the study protocol or cooperate fully with the research team

overall_official.affiliation: Weill Medical College of Cornell University
